quote: Surrealism: An archaic term. Formerly an art movement. No longer distinguishable from everyday life.
author: Brad Holland

quote: Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope, and that enables you to laugh at life's realities.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, it's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: American art in general... takes to surreal exaggerations and metaphors; but its Puritan work ethic has little use for the playful self-indulgence behind Parisian Surrealism.
author: John Updike

quote: Crazy Horse dreamed and went into the world where there is nothing but the spirits of all things. That is the real world that is behind this one, and everything we see here is something like a shadow from that one.
author: Black Elk,  Black Elk Speaks: Being the Life Story of a Holy Man of the Oglala Sioux

quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, It's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope. Which is what I do, And that enables you to laugh at life's realities.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Life is but a momentary glimpse of the wonder of this astonishing universe, and it is sad to see so many dreaming it away on spiritual fantasy.
author: Andy Mulcahy

quote: Set your fantasies in the here and now and then, if challenged, claim to be writing Magical Realism.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Manifestation is a process by which we transform seemingly unrealizable imaginations to reality.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Reality depresses me. I need to find fantasy worlds and escape in them.
author: Noel Fielding

quote: Models are there to look like mannequins, not like real people. Art and illusion are supposed to be fantasy.
author: Grace Jones

quote: She’s not a pothead. That thing on her neck is a vase. And anyway, I’m all for legalization. After all, why should surrealism be illegal?
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it.
author: Lloyd Alexander

quote: I had turned away from the picture and was going back to the world where events move, men change, light flickers, life flows in a clear stream, no matter whether over mud or over stones.
author: Joseph Conrad,  Lord Jim

quote: It’s strange how dreams get under your skin and give your heart a test for what’s real and what’s imaginary.
author: Jason Mraz

quote: Extraordinary magic is woven through ordinary life. Look around!
author: Amy Leigh Mercree

quote: Paranormal events are just edges of the infinite we “happen” to encounter.
author: Doug Dillon

quote: It's hard to tell where reality ends and illusions begins. They blend - then they separate
author: Lind Goodman

quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Through the darkest hours of the nightand through the dreamers realm I seek,Far beyond the starry skyand beyond galaxies I am free.Through the grimmest memoriesand past a seasons air I cannot breathe,Far beyond this mortal worldin an afterlife we shall meet.
author: Lee Argus

quote: Tapestry [10w] Life's a tapestry of mystery and miracles quilted by God.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Standing in the middle between the idea of an event and the actual event, a strange kind of physical reality just in the middle between possibility and reality.
author: Heisenberg

quote: The magic is only in what books say, how they stitched the patches of the universe together into one garment for us.
author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451

quote: Life is so magical, mysterious, magnificent, and peaceful.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Life is magic.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: When the immense drugged universe explodesIn a cascade of unendurable colourAnd leaves us gasping naked,This is no more than the ectasy of chaos:Hold fast, with both hands, to that royal loveWhich alone, as we know certainly, restoresFragmentation into true being.Ecstasy of Chaos
author: Robert Graves,  Poems 1965-1968

quote: Often the magical elements in my books are standing in for elements of the real world, the small and magical-in-their-own-right sorts of things that we take for granted and no longer pay attention to, like the bonds of friendship that entwine our own lives with those of other people and places.
author: Charles de Lint

quote: Science, you don't know, looks like magic.
author: Christopher Moore

quote: Imagination is the true magic carpet.
author: Norman Vincent Peale,  Norman Vincent Peale: Three Complete Books: The Power of Positive Thinking; The Positive Principle Today; Enthusiasm Makes the Difference

quote: Closed in a room, my imagination becomes the universe, and the rest of the world is missing out.
author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality

quote: All things of the body stream away like a river, all things of the mind are dreams and delusion; life is warfare, and a visit to a strange land; the only lasting fame is oblivion.
author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

quote: Whether divine or human, it is precisely the imagination that fashions and recognizes the universe as meaningful, abiding, and valuable, that is to say, as real.
author: William K. Mahony,  The Artful Universe: An Introduction to the Vedic Religious Imagination (S U N Y Series in Hindu Studies)

quote: Reality is what trips you up when you walk around with your eyes closed.
author: F. Paul Wilson,  Healer

quote: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Just as heart is a fountain of unspoken words,the universe is a womb of wonder weird worlds.
author: Toba Beta

quote: Invisible things are the only realities.
author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Loss of Breath

quote: Once we open our eyes to the infinite magic that the universe has in abundance, we are sure to be enthralled by what we see and this miraculous creation gets us closer to our dreams and to the world as a whole.
author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

quote: We co-create our reality with others in unseen ways.
author: Doug Dillon

quote: I consider a dream like I consider a shadow,” answered Caeiro, with his usual divine, unexpected promptitude. “A shadow is real, but it’s less real than a rock. A dream is real — if it weren’t, it wouldn’t be a dream — but less real than a thing. That’s what being real is like.
author: Álvaro de Campos

quote: If you want to see magic, love someone and see the magical transformation.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Our time here is magic! It's the only space you have to realize whatever it is that is beautiful, whatever is true, whatever is great, whatever is potential, whatever is rare, whatever is unique, in. It's the only space.
author: Ben Okri

quote: It turns out that an eerie type of chaos can lurk just behind a facade of order - and yet, deep inside the chaos lurks an even eerier type of order.
author: Douglas R. Hofstadter,  Metamagical Themas: Questing for the Essence of Mind and Pattern

quote: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
author: John Muir

quote: The universe is big. It's vast and complicated and ridiculous. And sometimes—very rarely—impossible things just happen and we call them miracles.
author: Steven Moffat

quote: It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.
author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

quote: At night I lay awake, her likeness casting dark shadows across my soul and senses, and my stomach throbbing away. I imagined her arms around me, lulling me into a phantom bliss, so frustrating, so unreal.
author: Stephen Mosley

quote: I feel infinite.
author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower

quote: Art distills sensations and embodies it with enhanced meaning.
author: Miguel de Unamuno
